DataElement.preferredName: Medical History Cardiac Disease Cardiac Toxicity Agent Assessment Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine clinical trial participation for questions related to the patient medical history of cardiac disease and history to cardiotoxic drug assessment as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Cardiac Disease or Disorder Cardiotoxicity Pharmacologic Substance Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Having to do with the heart._Any deviation from or interruption of the normal structure or function of a part, organ, or system of the body as manifested by characteristic symptoms and signs. [Dorland's Medical Dictionary]_Toxicity that impairs or damages the heart. This condition is often caused by the administration of a pharmaceutical agent that initiates a poisonous or toxic response in cardiac tissue._Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredName: Cardiac Disease or Disorder Cardiotoxicity Pharmacologic Substance Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the heart.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Toxicity that impairs or damages the heart. This condition is often caused by the administration of a pharmaceutical agent that initiates a poisonous or toxic response in cardiac tissue.:Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the heart.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Toxicity that impairs or damages the heart. This condition is often caused by the administration of a pharmaceutical agent that initiates a poisonous or toxic response in cardiac tissue.

Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient has a known hi
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been done and the patient is class 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been performed with a result of greater than class 2B?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have adequate cardiac function defined as no signs or symptoms of heart failure in a patient who has no history of congestive heart failure, no prior exposure to cardiotoxic drugs, and no radiotherapy to the heart; OR shortening fraction of greater than or equal to 27% or ejection fraction of greater than or equal to 50% by echocardiogram?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been done and the patient is class 2 or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, including anthracyclines, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been done?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been performed with a result of greater than class 2B and patient has a corrected QT (QTc) interval of less than 450 msec?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient class 2B or better on the New York Heart Association Functional Classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have New York Heart Association Functional Classification of class 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient classified as class 2B or better using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have New York Heart Association Functional Classification of class 2 or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been done and the patient is class 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a known history or current symptoms of cardiac disease, or history of treatment with cardiotoxic agents, has a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification been done and the patient is class 2B or better and LVEF is above the institutional upper limit of normal if LVEF measurement is available?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of cardiac disease including CAD, MI, cardiomyopathy, arrythmia, heart block, has an evaluation by history PE and appropriate testing been done to allow evaluation of any events that may occur on study?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.6.27 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002556. ak 9/23/22 added AQT for Theradex cjl;
